Brisbane International Film Festival - WON - Special Commendation
Locarno International Film Festival - WON - Netpac Award

"Suspenseful, moving yet ruthlessly unsentimental." - Jason Anderson, Eye Weekly

"A nearly perfect little film." - Shelly Kraicer, Vancouver International Festival

When an impoverished country couple adopts a crippled young girl and puts her to work begging on city streets, a battle soon ensues over her fate. With virtually no budget, a hand-held digital camera and a cast of non-professionals, director Peng Tao turns the sordid street life of small town China into a chain-reaction tale of human cruelty and unforgettable suspense.
